signature.implication: The system spends ~2/3 of its time in a single undifferentiated operational state. The controlled variable must have a dominant steady-state regime.

signature.value: All states exit to S4 at >56%. S4 self-loop = 0.698
signature.implication: The controlled variable returns to baseline after every perturbation. Deviations are transient, not cumulative.
The controlled variable has no long-range memory. Current state conveys all information about future evolution. The variable resets rapidly.

signature.value: FL_HAZ entry 6.5x more likely than FL_SAFE from operational mass
signature.implication: Risk events are much more common than safe-completion events. The controlled variable operates near hazard boundaries most of the time.

signature.value: Hazard perturbation decays in exactly 1 token (C967)
signature.implication: Hazard events are sharp pulses, not sustained crises. The controlled variable can be destabilized briefly but recovers in one step.

signature.property: Binary lane oscillation within operational mass
signature.value: QO/CHSH alternation with section-specific Markov + hazard gate (C966-C970)
signature.implication: The controlled variable has two complementary modes or phases that alternate. Not continuous variation — binary switching.

signature.property: REGIME modulates transition weights, topology fixed
signature.value: Global chi2=475.54, p=1.47e-48. FL markers regime-independent.
signature.implication: There is an external parameter (REGIME) that changes HOW INTENSELY the system operates without changing WHAT it does. The controlled variable responds to intensity scaling.
The MEANING of hazard and safe conditions does not change with operating intensity. Only the frequency of operational transitions changes.

signature.value: 54.7% of recovery paths go through e (stability anchor). Max 2 recovery cycles (89% reversibility).
signature.implication: The controlled variable can be stabilized by a specific operation (e). Recovery is not symmetric with destabilization — it requires a dedicated mechanism. And it has a hard limit.

signature.value: C171: no external reference points. C384: no A-B entry coupling.
signature.implication: The controlled variable is internal to the system. It does not reference external standards or measurements. All control is relative to internal state.

signature.value: C469: no parametric encoding. C287-C290: no magnitudes.
signature.implication: The controlled variable is assessed by categorical tests (pass/fail, present/absent), not by measurement. No numbers, no arithmetic.

signature.property: Minor execution group as transient feeder
signature.value: AXm->AXM 24.4x stronger than reverse. AXm = 3% of tokens.
signature.implication: There is a brief preparatory or transitional phase that feeds into the main operational regime. Not a separate mode — a ramp-up.

signature.value: FQ self-loop 0.251. All states flow to FQ at 9.5-25.1%.
signature.implication: There is a periodic monitoring/checking function that interrupts operational flow. In REGIME_4 (precision), this interruption rate increases.

signature.value: Mean position = 0.816, 73% in final third of line.
signature.implication: Safe/completion marking occurs at the end of control blocks (lines), not during them. It is a closure signal, not an ongoing status.
